title: Keira Knightley catches the eye in a breezy floral skirt as she leaves home
text:
Maternity leave appeared to be off the cards as Keira Knightley stepped out on Thursday, little more than a month after welcoming her second child with husband James Righton.

The British actress, who gave birth to a daughter in September, was joined by a team of assistants as she left her north London home.

Sporting a yellow floral dress and silver heels, Keira, 34, caught the eye as she idled on the street while a variety of plastic covered outfits were loaded into a waiting van.

In the swing of it: Maternity leave was off the cards as Keira Knightley prepared for work on Thursday, little more than a month after welcoming her second child

A make-up artist was also seen leaving the property with a cosmetics bag slung across one shoulder as they prepared to leave.

Keira and husband James confirmed that they had welcomed their second child on September 13 by taking the tot on a stroll in London. The pair have reportedly named the child 'Delilah.'

According to the Mail On Sunday, rocker James was also overheard telling friends all about the baby at a recent Hugo Boss yacht party.

Let's go: The British actress sported a yellow floral dress as she left her north London home ahead of an unspecified work commitment

Helping hand: A team of assistants loaded boxes, bags and a plastic covered dress into a waiting van

The couple announced that they were expecting again in May, when Keira debuted her bump at the Chanel J12 party in Paris.

Ahead of giving birth the pirates of the Caribbean actress was seen out and about in the English capital with her prominent baby bump on display.

Keira and James married in France in May 2013 and welcomed their first child, daughter Edie, in 2015.

She's off: A make-up artist was also seen leaving the property with a cosmetics bag slung across one shoulder as they prepared to leave

In January, Keira spoke about the challenges of motherhood and of juggling her career with caring for her daughter.

She told Balance magazine: 'I don’t think we give women enough credit for the physical and emotional marathon they go through when becoming a mother.

'I come from a place of amazing privilege. I have an incredible support system; I’ve been unbelievably lucky in my career; I can afford good childcare, and yet I still find it really f***ing difficult.'

She added: 'It’s OK to say that. It doesn’t mean I don’t love my kid, it’s just me admitting that the sleep deprivation, the hormonal changes, the shift in relationship with my partner, are all things that make me feel as if I’m failing on a daily basis.

'I have to remind myself that I haven’t failed, I’m just doing what I can do, but it’s not easy.'

Watch out: The white outfit was carefully loaded before Keira's departure on Thursday
description: The British actress, who gave birth to a daughter in September, was joined by a team of assistants as she left her north London home ahead of an unspecified work commitment.
